message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.DM, cs.NE 

This paper discusses a technique for constructing classifiers from imbalanced datasets, which is a common problem in machine learning. The paper specifically focuses on the use of synthetic minority class examples to improve classifier performance. This topic is relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computer vision (cs.CV), data mining (cs.DM), and neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE). Given the focus on machine learning and classification, cs.LG is the most likely sub-category, followed by cs.AI and cs.CV. The use of synthetic examples also suggests a connection to data mining (cs.DM), while the evaluation of the method using the area under the ROC curve suggests a connection to neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE).
